issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
I changed Ti.UI.iOS.createNavigationWindow to Ti.UI.createNavigationWindow because it was marked as deprecated in the docs (https://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/api/Titanium.UI.iOS-method-createNavigationWindow).

After trying to figure out the build error I was getting I've gone back to the docs and double checked and the deprecation notice seems to be for a future release. it reads "DEPRECATED since 8.0.0", the latest version is 7.5.0.GA.

Am I using the docs incorrectly? Is there a way to view documentation for a specific version? Unless I'm looking in the wrong place the documentation does not appear to reflect the currently released API.
fields.summary: Documentation deprecations are ahead of release.

comments.body: Hello, We have the master release of SDK 8.0.0, just not the GA release yet. These docs state the right info. Thanks.
